page.title: 01GREEN HAMMERTON AND WHIXLEY.
page.content: Green Hammerton and Whixley are lowland villages in Yorkshire. Most of the farmers are dairy or arable so much of the land is crops such as Oats, Barley, Wheat and Oilseed Rape. Green Hammerton lies in the vale of York. The city of York lies about 10 miles away to the south east. The school was in danger of closing down but was saved by the parents. But Whixley was closed down instead.Each village has a post office and a pub. The land has very rich soil and to buy an acre it would cost you Â£1500. There are three farmers in Green Hammerton. The village lies at the junction of three roads, one south east to York, one due north to Borobridge and one west to Knaresborough and Harrogate. Both Whixley and Green Hammerton are on Roman Roads to the R. town Aldbrough .
